intro: Vincetoxicum caffrum, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring thick, woody stems and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. Its botanical characteristics include a milky sap and a strong, aromatic odor, which are notable features in its identification. Vincetoxicum caffrum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine.
